name: AVA Hotel Athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place to stay for a first time visit to Athens. The rooms (we stayed in an Executive Apartment)was one of the largest I have seen anywhere, especially in Europe. It had a large bedroom, living room, kitchenette and a small patio where we would drag a couple chairs to when having our morning coffee. The bathroom was big enough to hold a small bed. The king size bed was typical european, 2 twins on a platform that kept seperating during the night.
reviews.title: What a great place. Thanks Trip Advisor for the heads up on this place.

likes.disliked: — The king bed matresses that kept seperating during the night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right in Plaka, you see the temple of Zeus and the Acropolis (well a very small part of it ,the Parthenon can not be seen at all, so do not be disappointed). The hotel is near a fairly busy street, but we were there on the weekend, so the noise was not bad. Being in Plaka, there were plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. You can skip breakfast at the hotel and walk into Plaka for breakfast at 1/2 the price.
reviews.title: THE only place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As all the sights in Athens are spread out, the location was neither good nor bad in that respect. We took a taxi from the airport, so we can not comment on the metro, although we hear it is good. If you want great taxi and limo service, look for George the famous taxi driver on the web.
reviews.title: friendly location
Athens-with-small-kids enabler
reviews.text: Many thanks to all the previous TripAdvisors who gave spot-on reviews of the excellence of this hotel. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in April 2007. The Ava is essentially a 5-star hotel in terms of service, cleanliness, and hospitality. It doesn't have the room service, pool, spa, and all the other frills that we never want to use when traveling on vacation. Time is too precious, and there is always so much to see and do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Athens is traffic-clogged and noisy. After walking around, we would not have wanted to stay at any of the 5-star hotels around Syntagma Square due to the overwhelming traffic noise. Syngrou Avenue is even worse. The Plaka is the only location we would ever recommend. And the Ava is on a quite side street that enabled us to keep the windows open at night and still get a perfect night's sleep.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: A great place to stay, location, amenities, staff etc all excellent. Huge room (apartment) for 3 adults with comprehensive kitchehette, bathroom etc. Wi-fi good, and with a 5 min stroll to the acropolis and great eateries etc what else could you need. Staff were great, proactive and very helpful.
reviews.title: all good..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in August 2008, the location was perfect if you wish to explore the plaka area, as it was right on the door step of the hotel, so there was was no need to use cabs, or public transport, the Acropolis was a very short walking distance too. We had an executive suite, which divides into two rooms, this is a good option if you require two hotel rooms with a five star standard, so ideal for a family with a added bonus having kitchen facilities. Overall this hotel reaches a high standard, great location, and friendly staff with views to the Acropolis and the temple of Zues, I would stay here again on my next visit to Athens.
reviews.title: Great Location for Plaka district

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in one of their 3rd floor suites and we're glad we did. The hotel is lovely, extremely clean, and very close to Hadrians Arch, the Parthenon, the Plaka district, and across the street from a bank which was important to us as we needed to exchange $. From our balcony we could see the Parthenon and Hadrians Arch. The monuments were so beautifully lit up at night as we sipped Greek wine on our balcony. Their breakfast, which was included in our room charge, was delicious and I will definitely miss the yogurt. Their staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the AVA for 5 nights recently. I visited Athens on business but wanted a hotel close to the monuments/sights to enjoy a couple of days sightseeing with my girlfriend. This hotel was great. Other reviews here compliment them on their hospitality - I have to agree totally, the staff were wonderful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Very Friendly/Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is located at the edge of the Plaka area of Athens. The Plaka is a bit of a tourist trap, but don't let that put you off - there are real gems to be found on ther periphery re: places to eat, drink, shop, sightsee, all within a few minutes walk from the AVA
reviews.title: Guest Service & Location - Best in Athens!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was the first night of our honeymoon on our way to the islands.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The huge balcony with a nice view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite which was big, comfortable and clean with a huge balcony.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When they found out it was our honeymoon, they gave us complimentary champagne and chocolates.
reviews.title: Not a worthy of four star "hotel"!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: AVA deserves its great reviews

likes.liked: — Location, staff, room size and amenities
likes.disliked: — Air conditioning outlet directly over bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is great for a short stay because it is close to all the main attractions and restaurants.
reviews.title: Superb quality, service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a gem! When we arrived we were so delighted to find it was on a quiet street in the Plaka area, with views of the Accropolis. Inside, the hotel did not disappoint either - an extremely friendly welcome, and one of the most comfortable and attractive hotels we have ever stayed in. Our room was one of the smaller appartment rooms, but was spacious enough, well appointed, and lots of thoughtfull extras. Breakfast was a delight! We only wished we were staying longer. Location could not be better - just beside the historic Plaka area with its great selection of restaurants, tavernas, and lovely shops, and close to all the main sites. If ever back in Athens, this will definitely be our first choice. Certainly not the cheapest, but well worth it!
reviews.title: Very Special Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Maybe a little bit pricey, but worth it!

reviews.title: AVA HOTEL - Worth a visit!
reviews.text: Visited AVA 14 -17 October.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While it isn't the Ritz-Carlton, AVA offers all the amenities one seeks for a pleasant, comfortable stay. The rooms are large, the staff is pleasant and helpful with advice and arranging for taxis (they use a taxi service that charges fair fares); it's located in a tourist -friendly section of Athens (Plaka) and walking distance to some of the great archeological sites in the world, and really good restaurants. Would I stay there again? Yes, without hesitation. (Try to get a room on the third floor with a verandah. Get some cheese, crackers, and red wine and enjoy the Acropolis at night!)
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked:
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in Athens, great value for the money!

likes.liked: — the size and furnishings of the room!
likes.disliked: — Maybe that they only served a continental breakfast, otherwise no negatives.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Executive Apartment on the front of the 2nd Floor.
reviews.title: Strongly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location, great accommodation, extremely friendly staff. If you want to see the sights of Athens, there is no better place to stay. Right inside the Plaka, good access to subway and just about anything else you will need. Champagne delivered on arrival, free tea and coffee inside room, free safety deposit box, free internet. All these extras make the slightly higher price worth it. And they deliver it all with a smile.
reviews.title: Comfort, convenient, very friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have been fortunate to travel considerably and therefore feel I am able to make constructive comments about properties I visit.
reviews.title: Exceptional Property with Hospitality to Match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Much has been written to date about the hospitality this exceptional hotel has to offer. The key words for this hotel are: Courtesy,Quality and Location. It certainly deserves its number One rating on Trip Advisor. All staff at this hotel, from the front desk to housekeping take pride in looking after their guests. This excellent property in not part of an International chain of mundane hotels, its owner gives considerable effort to ensure that anyone staying at the AVA will want to return.
reviews.title: Ava Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed in one of the Executive Apartments (102) overlooking the quite street outside the hotel. The rooms are very large with a small kitchen area and indeed one could enjoy a 'long stay' here.
reviews.title: Best Location, Huge rooms, Great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated within the Plaka, the old area of Athens, with plenty of history, restaurants and shopping on the doorstep. Since the Olympics of 2004 the city has been transformed, with care taken to impress its oversea visitors. So,if you are thinking of a visit to Athens then I can only endorse those complements other guests have given this splendid hotel, make a reservation, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is right in the heart of where you want to be in Athens. You are two minutes from Hadrians Arch, 2 minutes from the Plaka and all the restaurants and shops you want to visit, 5 minutes from the foot of the Acropolis and walking distance to almost all of the sites you want to see while in Athens proper. The hotel staff speak excellent english and are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are very large and clean. I would definitely stay there again and have recommended them to our travel agent and would not hesitate to recommend them to others traveling in that area of the world.
reviews.title: Loved the Ava Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The AVA Hotel lived up to everything that is said about it on trip advisor. We initially stayed 3 nights and really loved the spaciousness of the rooms, the location and how clean everything was. The breakfasts were generous by European standards with some great cakes offered each morning as a treat.
reviews.title: Comfort in a great location

likes.liked: — The quality of the accommodation for the price.

reviews.title: awesome location!
reviews.text: I can't imagine a better location and whilst the Plaka may be regarded as a bit "touristy" by some, for first time travellers to Greece it is just magic. It seemed that around every corner there was an ancient ruin that marked the foundations of modern society.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Another plus with the hotel's location is its proximity to the transport system and on our trip home it was an easy walk to the subway station and then via train to the airport. On arrival in Athens we caught a taxi to the hotel as it was the middle of the night/early morning. I would recommend this option for night arrivals as the street signs are not very clearly marked and the walk from the bus stop/subway station could be a bit daunting in the dark. Do print a map from the web site as our driver didn't know where it was even though I had a print out of the address.
reviews.title: Can we give this one SIX stars?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On another note, the reception staff were really helpful and were more than happy to keep our luggage overnight while we took the bare essentials on a quick trip to Meteora. On our return we were upgraded to a suite which was fabulous especially since our stay away had been a bit of a nightmare.
reviews.title: JUST DOESN'T GET ANY BETTER!

likes.liked: — The wonderful staff and cleanliness of the rooms.
likes.disliked: — Might have been nice to have a restaurant right in the hotel but wasn't really necessary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I think that the owners and staff of Ava Hotel rightfully take pride in their property. The location is outstanding; while it is in the Plaka district and accessible to everything, it is on a quiet street away from the tourist shops. As noted in many other reviews, the staff is outstanding. This is not a luxury hotel and does not misrepresent itself as one. They try very hard to satisfy the needs of travelers who want to keep their costs down without compromising comfort and quality.
reviews.title: An excellent tourist hotel. Very American friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AVA is in the most perfect location for exploring Plaka. You walk out the front door and everything you need and want to see is within easy walking distance. The rooms are modern, spacious and very clean. The views are also great. The staff are very friendly and most helpful. We would stay here again next time we visit Athens without hesitation.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - Perfect Location

likes.liked: — Location and very modern and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My one tip is to get a taxi straight from the airport, do not muck around with the train as the cost is almost the same, its a real hassle trying to get a taxi from the train station to the hotel, no one would take us as it was too short of a trip, but it was 38 deg and we had two suitcases and a wedding dress - not much fun walking...
reviews.title: Ideal location, great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: AVA Hotel is in a great location to see all the sights such as the Acropolis, Temple of Zeus and the Ancient Agora. We stayed in room 301 and had a wonderful view of both the Acropolis and the Temple of Zeus from our spacious balcony.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We checked in at 2AM and left at 3AM during our stay and they had someone waiting for us each time and also booked our taxi for us.
reviews.title: Good but not that great
A good as everyone says
reviews.text: We are usually "budget" travellers, but the added expense of staying at the AVA was completed justified by the:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) excellent location (eatting, the Acropolis, and the proximity to the Metro...who needs a cab?);
reviews.title: Fine hotel

likes.liked: — Spacious room, well kitted out with self catering facilities too, lovely bathroom
likes.disliked: — Slight noise from plumbing, people in neighbouring/upstairs room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2) the incredibly helpful staff (they had great suggestions for everything and were wonderful with our daughter);
reviews.title: Best possible location in Athens

likes.disliked: — Taxis don't always know this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) the comfortable rooms (very clean and pleasant...except why don't European hotels have regular King and Queen mattresses? My wife and I don't love negotiating "the gap"), and
reviews.title: Quality without compromise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: 4) the generous included breakfast. We were particularly happy with the breakfast because we were travelling with our daughter who, understandably, gets tired of restaurants.
reviews.title: The PERFECT place to stay in Athens!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the AVA Hotel for three nights. Truly, this is the best location in Athens. It is on a quiet street in the heart of the Plaka - turn the corner and you are at the restaurants and shops. We arrived late Saturday night in a rain storm. The front desk attendant came out and helped us with our bags and promptly checked us in.
reviews.title: Oasis in Athens

likes.liked: — The location of the hotel and friendly service.
likes.disliked: — The location of the room and hotel not recogizing our anniversary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first, to be honest, I was a little disappointed with the location of the room. It was on the same level as the lobby next to the office. There was no view from the room, just a patio from which you can look up to daylight. The positive aspect is that the room was located away from other guests and large for European standards.
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was good with numerous choices. My wife helped herself to a few extra granola bars for when I got hungry about an hour later.
reviews.title: Great location and wonderful staff

likes.disliked: — The very slippery tiled bathroom floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Example, there was an obnoxious guest in a red sweater and blue jeans with his wife and son making a big fuss about leaving his bags and transportation issues. Christina was extremely patient and professional with him.
reviews.title: Great Location!

likes.disliked: — one morning of a cold shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that I had mentioned to the hotel that we would be celebrating our wedding anniversary. We received no room upgrade, no bottle of wine, no note, nothing. I thought that a hotel known for such great service might have done something for us which would have turned an excellent stay into one of our best stays (see my review in Venice and Chania).
reviews.title: Best location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked AVA for three nights during our honeymoon and we were happy with our choice. AVA is far from a luxury hotel, but it was clean and efficient, and in a fabulous location. The staff was extremely nice and quite helpful in making reservations for tours (we recommend Athens Walking Tours with Despina) and restaurants. Only complaint: the bed was two twin beds pushed together -- less than ideal for a honeymoon!
reviews.title: Great stay at AVA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally placed, close to the Acropolys and Hadrians Arch. The rooms are spacious and elegant. The staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. The price was reasonable considering the quality of the accommodation and location of the property. All in all a very pleasant stay. Highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's all been said, and it's all true: It's impossible to imagine a better place to stay in Athens. Location, comfort, and staff (except for one snippy young lady who shall remain nameless) are all first-rate. I say this even though our last morning there was the morning that, as previously reported by "Robert from San Antonio," the hot water failed (I assume from the date on his review that it was the same morning -- at least I hope so).
reviews.title: Another Positive Vote for the AVA

likes.disliked: — Lack of awning on balcony/terrace so it could be used in midday summer heat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Three points that I don't think have been mentioned before:
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: (1) If you're picking up or dropping off a rental car in Athens, the AVA is just around the corner from the Avis, Hertz and Budget offices, which means no need for a taxi even if you're traveling with heavy luggage.
reviews.title: Everything it is advertised as being

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so happy with the Ava Hotel. It is a non-smoking facility (at least I didn't smell or see anyone smoking) which is a pleasant occurrence in Greece. The front desk was excellent in helping with directions and suggestions of places to eat and see. The breakfast buffet was good and had a little of hot and cold foods. (The bacon was cooked crispy -American style - unlike most we had in Greece). We were pleasantly surprised to find a small bottle of champagne and a bowl of fruit in our room.(I had mentioned my husband was celebrating a birthday). We were in room 204 which had the back view which overlooked a courtyard and was very nice with flowers and the neighboring buildings clean back areas. The location of the Ava could not have been better. It is a half block from the stores, etc of the Plaka area and about 2 blocks from the entrance to the Acropolis. The other way it is across the street from the National Gardens and about a half mile from Syntagma Square and the Parliment Building where the changing of the guard occurs on the hour. We found it easy to get around and see a lot of the sights. The only down side was that the rooms could use a little more soundproofing from each other but then that mostly depends on your neighbors. Ours luckily kept pretty much the same hours as we did.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a regular apartment, but upon arrival, seeing there were three of us, the owner gladly upgraded us to the executive suite, what a bonus!
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — great location, able to prepare light meals
likes.disliked: — at times, the smell of toilet came through the ventilator in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location is great, it's in Plaka which is only walking distance to all the historical sites and most museums. Also, metro Acropoli is only 5 minutes walk away if you'd like to explore further a field. We used it to go to Piraues.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location...
Great location.
reviews.text: Only down side is, the hotel has no pool or courtyard we could use, considering how good the weather was; would have been perfect to come home and still have a great time outdoor with a drink or two. The room was large, very clean and has kitchen equipped for preparing light meals.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of nice cafe and bars nearby. Both owner and staffs speak good English and always helpful to provide tips and tourist info.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Balcony, big room, free Internet, nice staff, good location
likes.disliked: — some street noise - windows could be thicker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. We stayed in 301 a very spaceous suite. Photos dont do justice to the quality of this hotel. From the marble bath with a glass shower and new porcelain to the quality furnishings it was remarkably well done. The balcony at night is breathtaking with the ruins lighted in two directions. We were in Europe for 18 days and this was the best for location and value. The staff could not have been better. They were friendly and wanted to do any thing they could to assist you with recommendations and maps as well as advice on resturants that were not tourist traps. We actually had a meal that was truely Greek modern food like the jet set would have had. Short walks to most of the Grecian ruins. Planka is close and on the way to the Acropolis. Rooms were very clean. Furniture was simple but nice and the balcony was" to die for."We were greeted in the morning when we arrived at 10:30 with a smile and very much help getting our baggage to the room. Let us check in way early as the rooms were ready within a few minutes of our arrival. We were greeted with a complimentary bottle of champaigne in the room shortly after we settled.Only the pickiest of travelers would not like this place.
reviews.title: The "Best"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: COMMUNICATIONS
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked our accommodations directly with the hotel from Canada. I had read the many wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor and had high expectations. My perception, based on the ease and professionalism of the booking process (and, please keep in mind that I was booking about 10 different hotels across Europe for our 1 month long honeymoon) was that AVA was a 4-5* large hotel. I was eagerly anticipating our stay here.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When we got to the hotel, it was much smaller and quainter than we had imagined. We were pleasantly surprised to hear that it was a family run business. When we arrived at check in, we were warmly greeted and were immediately made comfortable. Everyone who worked the front desk were so friendly!
reviews.title: best hotel in Athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: ROOM
reviews.title: Great stay!

description: AVA is a boutique Hotel situated at Plaka in the middle of the Historical Centre, at the foot of the Acropolis, on a quiet street. Surrounded by the worlds most renown monuments of Greek Civilization: Parthenon, Zeus Temple, Hadrian Arch, Agora etc. AVA offers spacious Suites & Apartments with all the amenities and comfort of an upscale Hotel, plus the exclusiveness and privacy of one's own home. AVA is a non smoking hotel.
